subject: FW: FW: Staging Sites for UK
preview: Hi Stella, This one is interesting. The live and staging are the same (if anything the staging site is more locked down and set to 'noindex'.) Perhaps when they are testing they have blocked/not acc

full_threads.body:
Hi Stella, 

This one is interesting. The live and staging are the same (if anything the staging site is more locked down and set to 'noindex'.) 

Perhaps when they are testing they have blocked/not accepted the cookie tracking. This could be the cause. 

Can they try in an incognito window OR make sure they accept the cookies before testing?

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,


Are you able to help with this please?


Thanks
Anita


Anita Manchester

Head of Marketing


m 0404 968 482

w stellainsurance.com.au





From: Winston Lawrence <winston@amplifir.com.au>
Sent: Monday, February 6, 2023 1:10 PM
To: Anita Manchester <anita.manchester@stellainsurance.com.au>
Cc: Andrew Bidese <andrew@amplifir.com.au>
Subject: Re: FW: Staging Sites for UK


Hi Anita,

Thank you for the update. I have configured a conversion event based on user landing on /Car/wrapup/thankyou in GTM/GA4.

There is still a slight issue with https://withstella.co.uk/ I'm unable to enable GTM preview mode to debug the tags deployed. This could be due to Site's content security policy blocking GTM/GA loading on the site or site preventing 3rd party cookies being set (GTM preview mode sets a 3rd party cookie). Could the dev team investigate and resolve it?
I note GTM preview mode works as expected on the staging site (screenshot below)


Prod site GTM debug view (no GTM tag found)



Cheers,
Winston


On Mon, 6 Feb 2023 at 09:24, Anita Manchester <anita.manchester@stellainsurance.com.au> wrote:

Hi Winston,

That's' great news - I had also heard from the team with the below:

Yes, that's right but there's another URL that should also be included - URL /Car/wrapup/complete.

This only won't be seen often as we only use it if the wrap up process fails on the Strata back office - everything appears to be complete from the customer perspective as the payment has been taken successfully, it's just a back office process that needs to be completed which we handle internally. The only thing the customer can't do at that point is register for their online account but they'll get a email to provide the details shortly after.

Thanks

Anita

Cheers,

In terms of prod page - I will confirm and come back to you.

Thanks

Hi Anita,

It appears the GTM snippet has been deployed to prod. Tracking appears to be working as expected.

Few things to note,

1. I was not able to complete an end to end quote journey in staging as it was throwing an error. So unfortunately, I couldn't confirm the conversion step for this journey.

2. By reviewing the prod data, I have made the assumption that any user arriving on page URL /Car/wrapup/thankyou has completed a policy purchase. Please confirm if this is correct (sample prod data below).

Cheers,

Winston

We can get this promoted to prod but didn't you want to use another id for this? If so, could you get it to us as soon as possible as today is the last day before new year that I have developer available.

From: Anita Manchester <anita.manchester@stellainsurance.com.au>
Sent: Wednesday, December 21, 2022 11:20 pm
To: Peter Olivant <Peter.Olivant@freedomservicesgroup.co.uk>
Cc: Dan Holland <dan.holland@freedomservicesgroup.co.uk>
Subject: RE: Staging Sites for UK

Hi Pete,

I've heward back from the team - see below:

Thank you for the update. I've managed to solve the jquery issue and am able to access the quote journey.

Please get the team to deploy the GTM snippet to the prod sites.

Also, please note, there is already another GTM container (ID GTM-P6Q8KTC) & GA4 code (G-56JETDEKWV) in use on withstella.co.uk.However, this GTM & GA4 codes are not present on quote.withstella.co.uk

I'm not sure who is managing this GTM & GA4, but if it's not required, would advise to remove it.

Please advise once the GTM snippet is deployed to prod.

Can you please let me know if you can action this for us?

Thanks

Anita

Anita Manchester

Head of Marketing

m 0404 968 482

w stellainsurance.com.au

From: Peter Olivant <Peter.Olivant@freedomservicesgroup.co.uk>
Sent: Tuesday, 20 December 2022 11:33 PM
To: Anita Manchester <anita.manchester@stellainsurance.com.au>
Cc: Dan Holland <dan.holland@freedomservicesgroup.co.uk>
Subject: Re: Staging Sites for UK

Hi Anita,

It seems the error is due to the code they're trying to inject via GTM. It's trying to use jQuery, which we don't have on our site. If jQuery is required, then they'll need to adjust how they're using it to ensure it's loaded before the code that needs to use it.

This link has some more info: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33755168/jquery-and-google-tag-manager

I think what was detected in production was due to one of our developers running a prod build locally. There's nothing currently present in the live site, although there was very briefly when we first went live but that was removed.

Hope this helps.

Thanks,

Pete

On Fri, 9 Dec 2022 at 12:35, Winston Lawrence <winston@amplifir.com.au> wrote:

Hi Anita,

Thanks for the update.

It appears that GTM has been added, but with errors. Meaning GTM isn't loading.

Since this is a react app, I suspect the traditional method of deploying the GTM snippet may not work.

If the team hasn't already tried, the following approach could be another way to get GTM on this section.

Add the following code inside the JS file that mounts the App component to index.html and react-gtm-module injects the tag manager code in the right places. Note that the GTM ID is GTM-52MX29K.

import TagManager from 'react-gtm-module'
const tagManagerArgs = {
gtmId: 'GTM-XXXXXX'
}
TagManager.initialize(tagManagerArgs)

Reference - https://github.com/alinemorelli/react-gtm

Cheers,

Winston
